required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Camrelizumab Combined With Rivoceranib Mesylate Versus Investigator's Choice of Regimen in Treatment of Patients With Advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-Label, Controlled, International Multi-Center Phase III Clinical Study of Camrelizumab Combined With Rivoceranib (Apatinib) Mesylate Versus Investigator's Choice of Regimen in Treatment of Patients With Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) Who Have Been Treated With Immune Checkpoint Inhibitors (ICIs)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, open-label, international, multi-center, phase III trial to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Camrelizumab Combined with Rivoceranib Mesylate versus Investigator's Choice of Regimen in Treatment of Patients with Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC)

intervention.description: Camrelizumab at 200 mg via intravenous administration (IV), once every 2 weeks (Q2W), in combination with 250 mg of rivoceranib mesylate, oral administration, once a day (QD)
Sorafenib tosylate (400 mg, twice a day (BID), po)
Regorafenib (160 mg, administer for 21 days then stop for 7 days, po)
